title: String.formatted()
summary: Call formatted() on the template string itself.
explanation: String.formatted() is an instance method equivalent to String.format() but called on the format string. It reads more naturally in a left-to-right flow.

whyModernWins.title: Reads naturally
whyModernWins.desc: Template.formatted(args) flows better than String.format(template, args).

whyModernWins.title: Chainable
whyModernWins.desc: Can be chained with other string methods.

whyModernWins.title: Less verbose
whyModernWins.desc: Drops the redundant String.format() static call.
